Articles.Content:
Kerbals/Kerbinians

Kerbals are a species of Bipedal animal on the planet Kerbin. They are about 1 meter tall, and have heads almost as large as their torso and limbs combined. Their huge, bulging eyes contribute to very good vision, and their green skin acts as camouflage. Camouflage against what predator? That's the real question here.
Type: Mammal
Surname: Kerman
Homeworld: Kerbin (Stock, Revamped Stock Kerbol System, Harder Solar System, Realistic Remode, etc)
Skin Color: Light Green.
Hair Color: White, Grey, Blond, Black, Brown, Orange.
Spoken language: Backwards Spanish, Mexican Accent.
Written Language: American English.
Personality: Lacking in foresight, intelligent, curious. Sometimes a little dumb tho.

Kerbulans

Kerbulans are actually the same species as Kerbals, except they were teleported thousands of years ago to a planet on the opposite side of the Sun from Kerbin. Kerbulans are almost indistinguishable from Kerbals physically, except unlike Kerbals, ALL male Kerbulans must wear a beard, by law.
Type: Mammal
Surname: Kermulan
Homeworld: Kerbulus (Kerbfleet Planets)
Skin Color: Light Green, all males have beards by law.
Hair Color: White, Grey, Blond, Black, Brown, Orange.
Spoken Language: Backwards Romulan, Russian Accent.
Written Language: Klingonese
Personality: Prone to drawing unfair or needless conclusions. Evil. Mildly intelligent, but extremely violent.

Alternians/Kibrenians

Alternians are simply Kerbals from an alternate universe where Kerbin orbits Jool. They are in many ways similar to Kerbals, except they have slightly more symmetrical eyes and only two fingers on each hand as opposed to three.
Type: Mammal
Surname: Alterman
Homeworld: Kibren (Alternis Kerbol)
Skin Color: Light blue.
Hair Color: White, Grey, Blond, Black, Brown, Orange.
Spoken Language: Backwards British English.
Written Language: Canadian French.
Personality: Tentative, curious, slower. Curious. Still lacking in foresight.

Amaps/Krenibons

Amaps are small, yellow, egg-laying mammals. Their smaller eyes mean that they do not see as well, but their tougher skin protects them from the chaffing dust of the equatorial lands that the species evolved in. The Amaps are bipedal.
Type: Marsupial
Surname: Unchaman
Homeworld: Krenib (Uncharted Lands)
Skin Color: Yellow-Green, Yellow, Yellow-Orange
Hair Color: White, Grey, Blond, Black, Brown, Orange.
Spoken Language: Backwards Australian English.
Written Language: Australian English.
Personality: Generally more BadS than the average sophont. They have a slightly more hostile planet than the average sophont, and it shows.

Horizontals/Sonnams/New Horizoner

Horizontals are short, bipedal reptile creatures on the moon Sonnah B. Their sharp teeth allows them to chew meat as well as plant matter. Horizontals have holes in the sides of their heads to better allow them to hear things.
Type: Reptile
Surname: Soman
Homeworld: Sonnah B (Kerbin from New Horizons)
Scales Color: Dark Blue
Hair Color: Grey, Brown, Black.
Spoken Language: Backwards Australian English.
Written Language: Australian English.
Personality: Frugal, Bureaucratic, Callous, not actually evil. They think they're smarter than you, but they aren't smarter than you.

Kerblets

Kerblets are baby Kerbals from Kerbin. It's uncertain just where they came from, but they seem to inhabit a planet that is one tenth the scale and ten times the density of Kerbin. They seem to be perpetually childish, as if there is a mental and physcial block on these Kerbals to mature into adults.
Type: Baby Mammal
Surname: Kerman
Homeworld: Kerbin (Toy Solar System)
Skin Color: Green.
Hair Color: Blond, Black, Brown, Orange.
Spoken Language: Broken Backwards Spanish, as if spoken by a four year old.
Written Language: Crayon.
Personality: Childish, young, extremely curious, and prone to thinking outside the box.

Artificial Life

A-Life is a computer simulation designed by Linus Kerman and Steve Kerman to simulate a society of living and thinking Kerbals. Their project was a remarkable success, modeling society and even a system-wide space presence. Their breakthroughs have even allowed the Kerbal Space Program to piggyback on their scientific growth and solve problems similarly to how the simulation does it. A-Life Kerbals are a complex simulation, modeling neural networks, neuro- and bio- chemistry, and movement joint physics.
Type: Computer Program
Surname: Kerman
Homeworld: A 1/10 scale simulation of Kerbin in the computers at the KSC on Kerbin.
Skin Color: ones and zeroes.
Hair Color: ones and zeroes.
Spoken Language: C#.
Written Language: Binary.
Personality: Interesting question. Let me show you the paper that Linus Kerman wrote about his little project.

Dunese

Dunese are tall bipeds which inhabit the planet Duna. They came from another star system, and set up shop on the planet Duna before it lost its oceans and atmosphere. As Duna died, the Dunese civilization mostly died with it. Only a small underground colony remains.
Type: Mammal
Surname: Dunaman
Homeworld: Duna (Duna Space Program)
Skin Color: Orange-red.
Hair Color: Dark red, brown, grey, black.
Spoken Language: !AAAAAAAAHHHHLLLUUUU
Written Language: Backwards German.
Personality: Warlike, technologically advanced, values honor. Generally rude to outsiders.

Evians

Evians are exotic life forms, made from different biochemistries than we are familiar with. Unlike the history of a surprisingly large portion of societies, much of the Evian history was Matriarchal instead of Patriarchal. 
Type: Exotic Flurocarbon-Sulfur Pseudo-Mammal
Surname: Eva
Homeworld: Eve (Eve Space Program)
Skin Color: Purple (like everything else on Eve.)
Hair Color: Orange, Blue, White, Multicolor.
Spoken Language: Backwards French.
Written Language: French.
Personality: You know the Tumblr SJW stereotype? A good 24% of them are like that. They're at war with the other 76% who aren't convinced that everything ever is offensive. In general, Evians are highly social creatures, and their society places a high value on friendship and family. They are also generally secular, and can be somewhat cynical at times as well.

Laythians

Laythians are an amphibious species, inhabiting the oceans and land masses of the Joolian satellite Laythe. They breath both with lungs and gills, depending on the situation. Life on Laythe has evolved in the harsh environment for billions of years to cope with the radiation and toxic waters of Laythe. As such, Laythians can be exposed to much higher levels of ionizing radiation without risk, proving quite a problem if a less-resistent species wants a peek at a Laythian spacecraft's engine room.
Type: Amphibian
Surname: Layman
Homeworld: Laythe (Laythe Space Program)
Skin Color: Dull Brown.
Hair Color: Dark Dull Blue, Brown, Black.
Spoken Language: Backwards Portuguese.
Written Language: Pig Latin.
Personality: Competent and Modest. However, they are also misinformed and generally ignorant. They do start sentences with disclaimers if they're talking about something which they know little of.

Helioshans

Helioshans are similar in many ways to Kerbals, except for their brains. There is something physically wired into their brains which makes them xenophobic. This can only be explained by it being a fitness trait in natural selection. Upon (reluctant) discussion with their historians, we found that their planet was being attacked by Deep Space Krakens for several hundred years. The only Helioshans that survived were the ones which had a natural fear of the unknown.
Type: Mammal
Surname: Heliman
Homeworld: Helios III (Outer Planets Mod)
Skin Color: Green, Salmon, Pale Blue, Purple.
Hair Color: White, Grey, Blond, Black, Brown, Orange.
Spoken Language: Backwards European Spanish.
Written Language: Backwards Italian.
Personality: Helioshans are defensive, but willing to accept and give help. Their space program is restricted to Helios III's SOI due to attacks from the Deep Space Krakens.

Tektonians

Tektonians are exotic methane-based life forms. Their homeworld is the moon of the gas planet Sarnus, and it is extremely cold there. Their civilization is as close to bronze age as it can get without the presence of bronze. There are not very many metals on Tekto, and any fires hot enough to melt metal would melt or even vaporize the ice rocks which make up the planet's surface. Tektonians appear to be a hybrid of mammal and amphibian. They secrete a nutrient broth for their young, but they also live in and out of the oceans.
Type: Exotic Polylipid-Methane Pseudo-Mammphibian
Surname: N/A
Homeworld: Tekto (Outer Planets Mod)
Skin Color: Pitch-Black.
Hair Color: "efficient" bald.
Spoken Language: Slow-Mo Backwards Russian.
Written Language: Dutch.
Personality: They're really slow moving and speaking, and it's really cold on their planet and well... we just couldn't figure out what they were all about before we had to left. We think they might be communists. They seem to have a totalitarian government, or maybe they were just moving too slowly for use to figure out their democratic system.

Areans

Areans are a primitive, stone age culture in the mysterious and gravitationally unstable Uranian system. They have only recently figured out how Agriculture works, and are triving to make their lives better through various means. Because of their lack of technology and science, they interpret virtually everything as a sign from one of their gods. Imagine their surprise when a rocketship lands on their doorstep.
Type: Mammal
Surname: Aremans
Homeworld: Ares (Urania)
Skin Color: Brown-red.
Hair Color: Black.
Spoken Language: Reverse Egyptian.
Written Language: Egyptian Hieroglyphs.
Personality: Simplistic. Easily excitable. They only just figured out agriculture, after all.

Eratonians

Eratonians are heavily-fur-coated mammals on the Uranianian moon Erato. They are a highly organized, technological society, mostly living underground in massive complexes.
Type: Mammal
Surname: McErato
Homeworld: Erato (Urania)
Skin Color: Dull, Pale Blue.
Hair/Fur Color: White.
Spoken Language: Reverse American English.
Written Language: Reverse Klingon.
Personality: Militaristic, putting a high value on camaraderie.

Asclepians

Asclepians are huge, large-winged bird creatures on the planet Asclepius. They are hunters by nature, but they have long since abandoned the age of stone tools for a more refined era of steam power. Despite their low technology, the low delta-v to orbit around Asclepius has allowed the Asclepians to conduct space faring operations with minimal technology.
Type: Avian
Surname: Aslepiman
Homeworld: Asclepius (Asclepius: The SSTO Playground)
Feather Color: White, Red, Black
Spoken Language: They can learn any language within a few days.
Written Language: Hexadecimal code for the Turkish language in Unicode.

Deep Space Krakens.

Space Krakens are creatures which are made out of spacetime in the same way Kerbals are made out of matter. They are more like sapient disturbances in spacetime than actual creatures. They do however often take the appearance of a real kraken-like monster when in the presence of another sophont.
Type: Exotic Spacetime Anomaly
Surname: Krakeman.
Homeworld: Galactic Core, Formerly Kerbin (Galactic Neighborhood)
Skin Color: Red with Orange Stripes, Yellow with glowing yellow stripes, Green with Yellow stripes.
Hair Color: N/A.
Spoken Language: The language that a nail speaks when it is scratched against a chalkboard.
Written Language: Pure Dread.

Humans/Terrans/Earthlings

Imma just assume that we all know what a human being is.
Type: Mammal (Humanoid, to be specific.)
Surname: Johnson, Smith, Armstrong, etc.
Homeworld: Earth (Real Solar System)
Skin Color: Black, Brown, Yellowish-Brown, Brownish-Pink, Pale Pink, White.
Hair Color: White, Grey, Blond, Black, Brown, Orange.
Spoken Language: English, Russian, German, just to name a few. There's a *lot* of languages here.
Written Language: ditto.
Personality: Humans are surprisingly compassionate and empathetic beings, all things considered. But they can also be violent, terrible, mean, loving, happy, excited, intelligent, stupid, and pretty much anything else.

Hyoomahns/Terins/Earthlies

Despite their constant assurances that they are, in fact, human beings, these Hyoomahns seem to have more in common with Kerbals or Helioshans than Humans from Earth.
Type: Mammal. I swear.
Surname: Sherman
Homeworld: Definitely Earth and not at all Kerbin (Stockalike Solar System)
Skin Color: Black, Brown, Yellowish-Brown, Brownish-Pink, Pale Pink, White.
Hair Color: White, Grey, Blond, Black, Brown, Orange.
Spoken Language: Italian
Written Language: Engrish. (English badly translated from chinese, japanese, etc.)
Personality: Are you sure these aren't just repainted Kerbals? They act just like Kerbals, except they constantly insist that they're definitely hyoomahns. @Sigma88, did you sell me a ripoff solar system?

Martians

"No one would have believed in the last years of the nineteenth century that this world was being watched keenly and closely by intelligences greater than man's and yet as mortal as his own; that as men busied themselves about their various concerns they were scrutinised and studied, perhaps almost as narrowly as a man with a microscope might scrutinise the transient creatures that swarm and multiply in a drop of water. With infinite complacency men went to and fro over this globe about their little affairs, serene in their assurance of their empire over matter. It is possible that the infusoria under the microscope do the same. No one gave a thought to the older worlds of space as sources of human danger, or thought of them only to dismiss the idea of life upon them as impossible or improbable. It is curious to recall some of the mental habits of those departed days. At most terrestrial men fancied there might be other men upon Mars, perhaps inferior to themselves and ready to welcome a missionary enterprise. Yet across the gulf of space, minds that are to our minds as ours are to those of the beasts that perish, intellects vast and cool and unsympathetic, regarded this earth with envious eyes, and slowly and surely drew their plans against us. And early in the twentieth century came the great disillusionment."
Type: Brain-Tripod
Surname: Unknown.
Homeworld: Mars (Little Green Men from Mars, The War Of The Worlds)
Skin Color: Dull Dark Red.
Hair Color: N/A.
Spoken Language: ULLAH!
Written Language: Unknown.
Personality: They feel superior to all other known life. They are warlike, territorial, and heavily colonial as a culture. Their planet sucks, so they want to get Earth.

Damogrox

Damogrox are a race of highly advanced intelligent mammals in the depths of the Kerbol system. Their planet was once in an orbit near that of Kerbin's, but a failed Faster-Than-Light propulsion test catapulted the planet out past the furthest Kerbol-orbiting planet. They now hide beneath the ice sheets of their once lush, now cold and barren wasteland of a planet, clinging to the nuclear energy given by their artificial moon D2. They are also mechanically augmented, half-cyborg creatures.
Type: Mammal
Surname: Damoman
Homeworld: Damogroth (Planet Pack X -- Unreleased)
Skin Color: Dark Blue.
Hair Color: White.
Spoken Language: Reverse Grox. (You know, from Spore)
Written Language: Latin.
Personality: Un-emotional, logical.

Odonian

Odonians are a species of lizard on the planet Odo. They are very small in size, but nonetheless have a society, complete with limited agriculture and art and science.
Type: Reptile
Surname: Odoman
Homeworld: Odo (Planet Pack X -- Unreleased)
Scale Color: Brown.
Spoken Language: Reverse Arabic
Written Language: Chinese.
Personality: Curious, artistic.

Edited May 22, 2016 by GregroxMun
Edited Evian description and added Odonian and Damogrox.

9 hours ago, GregroxMun said:

@Sigma88, did you sell me a ripoff solar system?

absolutely not.

That is definitely earth, you can see it has africa... or is it south america? I can never tell
